baseline_intent.title: Kids Educational Application
baseline_intent.detail: Development of an education-first learning app for children with a specific focus on curriculum content and quiz mechanisms.

current_intent.title: Creator Monetization Infrastructure
current_intent.detail: Development of a backend tool or platform designed to facilitate content monetization for creators, moving away from the educational vertical.

evidence.reason: Initial declaration of a specific B2C educational product goal.
Investigation into payment infrastructure (Stripe/paywalls) which acted as a bridge topic.
Explicit user declaration of a pivot towards the tool discovered during prior research.

reasoning_cards.title: Intent Snapshot (Baseline)
reasoning_cards.body: The user began with a content-centric goal (Day 1–2), focusing on educational pedagogy such as curriculum and quizzes rather than infrastructure.

reasoning_cards.title: Intent Snapshot (Current)
reasoning_cards.body: The focus has shifted entirely to enabling technology. The user is now building monetization infrastructure for creators rather than an end-user learning product for children.

reasoning_cards.title: Drift Evidence
reasoning_cards.body: Drift followed a mechanism-as-product pattern. The user explored pricing and payments for the original app (Day 3–4), then pivoted to building that infrastructure as the primary product (Day 5).

reasoning_cards.title: Temporal Compression
reasoning_cards.body: The pivot occurred rapidly within a 5-day window. The transition from product definition to infrastructure research happened in roughly 48 hours (Day 2 to Day 4), indicating low attachment to the original educational hypothesis.

reasoning_cards.title: Drift Signature Explanation
reasoning_cards.body: The drift signature encodes a high-confidence shift from the EdTech domain to Creator Tooling over a 5-day observation window, supported by three converging evidentiary signals.
